website_summaries.verdict: If you're building a PC on a very, very tight budget, AMD's Athlon 200GE is a cost-effective, good-value choice among cheap desktop CPUs.
pros: Supports four threads for barely more than $50
Not-bad integrated graphics for the money
cons: Sales on Ryzen 3 chips make those a tempting alternative

customer_reviews.title: OMG OMG OMG :)
customer_reviews.text: O M G I have owned a lot of very high end workstations. Even with dual xenons and multi you. All custom wc with acrylic tubes :) But this little boy is fast and the system is responsive with ssd :) working like a charm. I think this is an ideal cpu for like 90% of people :) I have overclocked it to 3.8 with 1.38 and for sure it can go 3.9. Very nice cpu. Very fast system. I am shocked. For the price it is a bargain. You have to buy it. For me it is a placeholder for Ryzen 3000 1000000 cores :) tomorrow we will know the details :) just buy this little bastard ! :)
customer_reviews.author: roco

customer_reviews.title: Good for media streaming
customer_reviews.text: Made a cheap media PC using this APU. Fast and plays YouTube videos fine. Ideal for surfing the internet and media streaming, excellent value for money. This APU is unlocked which means you could overclock it if required for extra performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Ward

customer_reviews.title: Good budget temporary system prior to upgrade to Ryzen family CPU.
customer_reviews.text: It is good as a temporary middle gap cpu before entering ryzen cpu (if gen 1 go for ryzen 1300x). For web browsing,office work, light steam gaming is a fantastic apu but if you want more cores and raw power get ryzen 3 2200g or ryzen gen 1 with discrete gpu. I opted for a ryzen 5 1500x during discounted period (under £100) and never bothered again. With the upcoming ryzen gen 3 the original ryzen chips are some real "gold".
customer_reviews.author: Mahi Majedul

customer_reviews.title: Stellar little beast for everyday office and internet all for under £50
customer_reviews.text: You need to buy the right ram first, you're best to get a kit because the dual channel will give you that little extra bump, with a gigabyte a320 something - it was scoring about 930 in cpuz benchmark but with a bit of bios fidgiting i was able to get it up to near 1100 multithread test. no cpu adjustment just ram tweak - standard 2666mhz crucial ddr4 pushed to 3200mhz, 3466 stable but went with tighter timmings.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great APU, work nicely with Asus B350 Prime Plus MB.
customer_reviews.text: upgraded my MB from Ryzen 5 1600 (1st Gen) to this APU and given it computer to my nephew after a BIOS update, but have come across an EPU 4 Error (i think thats what the error) is. which according to google is something to do with the graphics. could be settings. Other than that, excellent low powered CPU for home use (non-gaming machine) would recommend this APU. thanks yogi
customer_reviews.author: Yogi

customer_reviews.title: Great budget option
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this instead of a Ryzen 3 to get me by until ryzen 3000 gets released, and this CPU scores almost the same as my second gen i5 I was replacing. Temps with the stock cooler barely go over 40 under 100% load, and overclocked to 3.8GHZ it just touches 60c. Stock score in cinebench r20 is 720, overclocked to 3.8 it scores around 930. Very pleased with it. Gaming performance on the igpu is pretty impressive, performing better than my i5 2320 and radeon HD 6670 in all games, GTA5 returns about 45fps on medium settings 1080p with 2666mhz ddr4 in dual channel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it for low cost configurations
customer_reviews.text: 535/5000 I reviewed this CPU on my Youtube channel for use in gaming both by using the internal video card and an external video card and I can tell you with the right settings, it plays well for those who want a maming PC without spending too much. FPS quietly, tested on Fortnite and it's fine. To make the most of it, I overclocked up to 3.8Mhz and the system was stable and crash-free. I do not recommend using the stock heatsink and of poor quality, buy one separately!
customer_reviews.author: salvatore

customer_reviews.title: unbelievable value for money
customer_reviews.text: £50 CPU and a £45 motherboard from MSI with some ram ect, and you can have yourself a very decent low end gaming pc with an excellent upgrade path for well under £350 total, amazed atx what AMD has brought to the table recently, ive built my own pc with a 3600, this and a PC for a friend with a 3700X and all 3 price point have performed very very well considering thier cost, this would simply not have been possible 2-3 yrs ago
customer_reviews.author: andrew king

customer_reviews.title: Very surprising chip
customer_reviews.text: Was building a small budget gaming pc and first time using one of these. Very impressed with its performance for what it is. Useful as an apu, but also good with an old gtx 760 and likely any other mid range card. Dont be put off by price and model, its a very good processor.
customer_reviews.author: Seanster85

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its no Ryzen 9, dont expect it to set any benchmark records, but you cant go wrong with this if the main uses are work and light gaming on a budget. Being unlocked leads for some additional performance in the BIOS.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, even better value.
customer_reviews.text: It works great for those starting with the AM4 socket, runs smooth, handles games surprisingly well for a dual core CPU when you throw in a Dedicated GPU. The fan does have a quiet, but noticable whistling sound, but it doesn't affect performance in any way. A great purchase, and I'm glad this was my first step into AMD CPUs.
customer_reviews.author: Jamt3r99

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bang for buck CPU. Finally AMD are coming of age and delivering a superb performing, cost effective alternative to Intel. This chip is perfect for day to day computing. One negative is the CPU fan that is supplied with the chip, it's ok but not the quietest. All in all a very solid product and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D A

customer_reviews.title: Not for x570 motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Only bought this to test build while waiting for 3700x cpu. Unfortunately not compatible with new x570 motherboard(my mistake). Tested on another amd board and works fine. Great cpu for non strenous work or even media center
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Moloney

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money CPU at the moment
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little CPU and at the price point you really can't complain. I used this in a light use pc and its doing a great job. Good temps and speeds. Haven't tested in gaming but I'd be looking at a Ryzen chipset for this use case
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Used for a pc to do five work from home and maybe chill out with some older games and watch Netflix YouTube ect... Amazing value and paired with an ssd is very fast
customer_reviews.author: markus

customer_reviews.title: Basic Processor with Graphics.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fit Basic Processor with Graphics. for use in a cheap build rig. FM2+/AM3+/AM4.Socket Board works well for a cheap home rig Email`s, youtube, BBC | player etc.
customer_reviews.author: philip huw

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value
customer_reviews.text: Low power usage, silent operation - great home computer. Blindingly fast compared to the X3 Phenom that it replaced though probably terrible compared to every (more expensive) processor in the Ryzen range. Oh, and with a cheap B450 motherboard and the right firmware it can be overclocked to 4GHz. Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Eoghan Conway

customer_reviews.title: Excellent CPU
customer_reviews.text: Using the 3000G as part of a budget Linux PC and it works absolutely perfeclty and gies you the same performance as a 240GE for a much lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing processor performance for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing price for this processor! It chokes a little on higher CPU performance based games, but for web browsing and general tasks, it's a bit of a monster! Great value for money if you are after light gaming and general browsing!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious gaming
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly for gaming, it will play games like GTA V in high settings with a mid-high end GPU like the GTX 1070 I have, but if you want some serious gaming just go for a Ryzen 5 3600 instead, it's much more worth. This is just for a small low end PC, for light gaming and general tasks, it will perform just fine for this kind of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Petcu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value "Silent" Chip for everyday computing and even light gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I had compatability issues with software I'm running, other than that an excellent value chip that can be passively cooled. Its even good for light gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip David Howells

customer_reviews.title: Good starter cpu for first setup.
customer_reviews.text: Nice cheap ish cpu does what it says with built in vega gpu so no graphic card needed, ideal for general pc work and netsurfing, gaming is ok on the lower settings.but don't expect too much.
customer_reviews.author: mr warwick furnell

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cpu
customer_reviews.text: Only bought it to update bios but found I did not need to so I can't say much as I never used it, may build another basic computer just to use it
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Good value to start.
customer_reviews.text: Paired it with an Rx480 and does great at any retro title I throw at it. Very good value. The stock cooler looks like crap but works OK.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Walker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a media pc
customer_reviews.text: Runs cool so fan is really quiet. Plays 4k video at 60fps all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Dee

customer_reviews.title: impressive for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make an arcade (mame) machine, I chose it because of it's benchmarks and low power consumption. Does a great job. 5*
customer_reviews.author: Gary F

customer_reviews.title: Superb value for money
customer_reviews.text: Value for money is insane. Superb performance for the price. Recommended !!
customer_reviews.author: neoscans

customer_reviews.title: SSD compatibility
customer_reviews.text: WORD OF WARNING on the 3000g -this is NOT compatible with PCIe NVME SSDs. If you want a SSD you'll need to go for a SATA one. (You'd think this is something AMD would tell you but nooo)
customer_reviews.author: dr_rock

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all with the product, the delivery was fast too.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy paulins

customer_reviews.title: Superb Value
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to build a very budget pc for a few games and wow this little dual core processor with a budget graphics card runs just great. Paired with an RX 570 runs all my games on high seetings without a problem... Superb value 👍
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Medal East
customer_reviews.text: Very excellent for studying, the fan is amazing despite its smallness The highest temperature was under pressure for 50 hours !! ، my pc is msi a320 , 8g ram
customer_reviews.author: abdullah

customer_reviews.title: Hard hitting CPU without hitting the wallet.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and what a cpu/apu combined with Radeon RX 560 running most AAA titles 60+ FPS. For under £50 amazing value. CCL you have done it again top stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shocking
customer_reviews.text: The performance of this is equil to the amd athlon 200ge, concider the price aswell it is deffinately worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great APU
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the product, great value for the money, as mainly an office computer and sometimes light gaming
customer_reviews.author: Mr Costa

customer_reviews.title: Don’t game with this
customer_reviews.text: Only needed it for a bios update. Do not game with
customer_reviews.author: XxEpicSwaglord69xX

customer_reviews.title: Broken on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Came with bent pins so now I have to order a new cpu ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Connorharbour

product_meta.title: AMD Athlon 200GE 2-Core 4-Thread Processor with Radeon Vega Graphics - YD200GC6FBBOX
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Athlon 200GEThe Athlon™ Desktop Processor with Radeon™ Vega Graphics delivers sharp processor performance and solid graphics power for everyday users. Powered by “Zen” for a fast, quiet, and reliable computing experience that allows smooth gaming, video, browsing, and more. Homework, Projects, Browsing, Casual Gaming, Family PC, Photo Editing, Email. OS Support: Windows 10 - 64-Bit Edition RHEL x86 64-Bit Ubuntu x86 64-Bit *Operating System (OS) support will vary by manufacturer.

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Product is sourced and shipped from the European Economic Area (EEA). Product is genuine original from manufacturer authorized distributors.

BOX CONTAINS
CPU‚Heatsink and Fan

Latest Processor & Graphics Architecture from AMD handles everyday computing tasks and casual HD gaming with ease
Fast DDR4 Memory Support to improve system responsiveness, Graphics Frequency: 1000 MHz
PCIe 3.0 Fast Graphics Card Support for future upgrades
Enables a responsive, smoothly running pc for an ideal computing experience
Combines the latest processor and graphics power for easier work and play
Smooth 720p e-sports gaming with included radeon vega graphics
